lessons.title: The Evolution of Sports Nutrition & The PERFORM Method™
outline: Historical perspective: Transitioning from traditional 'bulking and cutting' to modern precision performance nutrition.
Introduction to The P.E.R.F.O.R.M. Athletic Method™: A systematic breakdown of the seven pillars of elite athletic fueling.
The shift in metabolic science: Moving beyond 'Calories In vs. Calories Out' toward nutrient timing and hormonal signaling.
Market analysis: Examining the $45B+ global sports nutrition industry and the demand for evidence-based practitioners.
Defining the 'High-Performance Athlete' in 2024: From professional competitors to tactical athletes and executive performers.

lessons.title: Scope of Practice, Ethics, and the Performance Team
outline: Legal and professional boundaries: Differentiating between a Sports Nutrition Coach, Registered Dietitian, and Medical Doctor.
The 'Do No Harm' framework: Ethical considerations in supplement recommendations and extreme weight-cutting protocols.
The Multi-Disciplinary Team (MDT): How to effectively communicate with head coaches, athletic trainers, and physical therapists.
Referral triggers: Identifying red flags (EDs, RED-S, clinical pathologies) that require immediate medical intervention.
Client confidentiality and data protection: Managing sensitive biometric and performance data in a digital coaching environment.

lessons.title: Career Pathways and Niche Mastery
outline: Specialization strategies: Analyzing the needs of endurance, power/strength, team sports, and aesthetic athletes.
The Business of Performance: Revenue models including 1-on-1 elite coaching, digital group programming, and corporate athletic consulting.
Developing your 'Unique Coaching Proposition' (UCP) using the PERFORM methodology as a competitive differentiator.
Athlete psychology and buy-in: Understanding the motivational drivers of high-achievers and the 'perfectionist' athlete mindset.
Building a referral engine: Networking with local gyms, sports clubs, and collegiate programs to scale your practice.

lessons.title: Evidence-Based Practice & Critical Appraisal
outline: The Hierarchy of Scientific Evidence: How to weigh meta-analyses versus individual case studies in sports science.
Deciphering the data: Understanding P-values, Effect Sizes (Cohen's d), and Confidence Intervals in nutrition research.
Combating 'Bro-Science': Strategies for debunking prevalent myths in the fitness industry using peer-reviewed literature.
The 'Practice-Led Evidence' model: Balancing clinical research with real-world application and athlete-specific biofeedback.
Establishing a systematic assessment workflow: Integrating the 'Results Tracking' pillar of PERFORM into initial client onboarding.

lessons.title: Foundations of Nutritional Periodization
outline: Defining Nutritional Periodization (NP) and its evolution from traditional static dieting.
The physiological rationale: Hormonal signaling, glycogen management, and metabolic efficiency.
Introduction to the three levels of periodization: Macrocycles, Mesocycles, and Microcycles.
The 'Fuel for the Work Required' paradigm: Moving beyond calorie counting to performance fueling.
Impact of periodized nutrition on injury prevention and long-term athletic longevity.

lessons.title: The Macrocycle: Long-Term Nutritional Planning
outline: Mapping the Annual Training Plan (ATP) to long-term nutritional objectives.
The Off-Season: Strategies for metabolic restoration and foundational muscle building.
The Pre-Season: Shifting focus toward sport-specific energy demands and body composition refinement.
In-Season Management: Maintenance of peak performance, weight stability, and immune support.
The Transition Phase (Post-Season): Psychological breaks and nutritional recovery protocols.

lessons.title: Mesocycle Integration: Hypertrophy, Strength, and Power
outline: Nutrient partitioning requirements for Hypertrophy blocks: Maximizing the anabolic window.
Fueling for Strength phases: Managing neurological demands and optimizing creatine stores.
Power and Speed blocks: Maintaining high-quality output while supporting Central Nervous System (CNS) recovery.
Adjusting macronutrient ratios (Protein-to-Carbohydrate) across different 4-6 week training blocks.
Case studies on transitioning nutrition between contrasting mesocycles.

lessons.title: Microcycle Adjustments: Daily Fueling Strategies
outline: Implementing Carbohydrate Periodization: High-intensity vs. Low-intensity training days.
Intra-day periodization: Strategic nutrient timing around specific training sessions.
The 'Low Energy Availability' (LEA) risk: Identifying and preventing deficits on light training days.
Managing the nutritional demands of double-session days (Two-a-days).
Practical tools for athletes to track and adjust daily intake based on perceived exertion.

lessons.title: The Competitive Phase: Peak Performance & Tapering
outline: The Nutritional Taper: Maintaining energy balance while reducing training volume.
Evidence-based Carbohydrate Loading: Comparing Classical vs. Modern 24-hour protocols.
Pre-competition meal timing: Optimizing gastric emptying and blood glucose stability.
Logistics of 'On-the-Road' nutrition: Managing travel, hotels, and tournament-style fueling.

lessons.title: Body Composition Management within the Cycle
outline: The science of 'Building' vs. 'Cutting' in an athletic context without compromising performance.
Managing the 'Post-Competition Aftermath': Avoiding rapid fat regain and metabolic rebound.

lessons.title: Practical Implementation: Building the Periodized Plan
